herstory, the stories women tell of their past, usually based on interpersonal relationships: births, deaths, relocations, marriages, etc.; “Mary was pregnant with her second when…”, “Just about the time the tribe moved to…” Differentiated from “eri=>history” in that “eri” strives for neutral record keeping, whereas both “dedideheril” and “dedideherilid” stress the story of the past. [dedide=story + (h)eril=past] {new}

his-story; the stories men tell of their past, usually based on wars, conquests, major disasters; the way the past is told in most late 20th century “history” books. Differentiated from “eri=>history” in that “eri” strives for neutral record keeping, whereas both “dedideheril” and “dedideherilid” stress the story of the past. [dedide=story + (h)eril=past + -id=male] {new}
myth, does not mean untruth [dedide=story; woth=wisdom] {orig}
friendliness, despite negative circumstances, to be friendly (dena, dina, dona, duna=friendliness) {orig}
to weep, cry (not said of babies) {orig}
someone you can see right through [dem=window + -á=suffix for doer] {orig}

to tell news [di=tell + shóo=happen; come to pass + dal=thing] {AB}

interface, to interface (It would be appropriate for the interface the linguists used in the Native Tongue trilogy to let their infants acquire Alien languages natively; it would be appropriate for the interface that was used to allow human/dolphin interaction in that area of research. It would be appropriate for those diagrams that show two or more areas with overlapping bits — territory where both or all of the areas overlap.) {orig}
to dominate with evil intent [dórado=to dominate + lh=negative connotation] {orig}

(sublimation with food accompanied by guilt about that sublimation) This word has no English equivalent whatsoever. Say you have an average woman. She has no control over her life. She has little or nothing in the way of a resource for being good to herself, even when it is necessary. She has family and animals and friends and associates that depend on her for sustenance of all kinds. She rarely has adequate sleep or rest; she has no time for herself, no space of her own, little or no money to buy things for herself, no opportunity to consider her own emotional needs. She is at the beck and call of others, because she has these responsibilities and obligations and does not choose to (or cannot) abandon them. For such a woman, the one and only thing she is likely to have a little control over for indulging her own self is FOOD. When such a woman overeats, the verb for that is “doroledim”. (And then she feels guilty, because there are women whose children are starving and who do not have even THAT option for self-indulgence… ) {orig}
to enable, to make possible or easy [dó=cause-to + thad=to be able]
enabler, one who enables, makes things possible or easy [dó=cause-to + thad=to be able + á=suffix for doer]

to enable another to persist in self-destructive behavior (for instance substance abuse) by providing excuses or by helping that individual avoid the consequences of such behavior [dó-=cause-to + thad=to be able + -(e)lh=pejorative]

enabler, one who enables another to persist in self-destructive behavior (for instance substance abuse) by providing excuses or by helping that individual avoid the consequences of such behavior [dó-=cause-to + thad=to be able + -(e)lh-=pejorative + -á=suffix for doer]

spouse (“Bíi eril X i Y meheba wa.” [X and Y got married. (More literally, “X and Y spoused.”) The verb gets the plural prefix and an epenthetic H.] Láadan wouldn’t allow “X married Y” or “Y married X,” which presuppose that marrying is something one person can do to another. It has to be a joint action, done together.) {orig}

a, the final one, the last one [no-=prefix implies completion + nede=one, 1]     {orig}

to cease to thrive [no-=prefix implies completion + tháa=to thrive, to do well]     {orig}
to feel oneself cherish, cared for, nurtured by someone     {orig}
contentment for bad reasons [nehena, nena, nina, nona=contentment]     {orig}
to body-remember (like remembering how to ride a bicycle) [oba=body + dom=remember]     {new}
a clean body, to clean ones body [oba=body + (h)éthe =clean] (see obahéthewod, obahéthethib)     {new}

during (I work during the night. -> Bíi hal le náaleya obée wa.)     {orig}
to caress with the lips, kiss [odama=lips + lámála=caress]     {SH}
branch [oda=arm + yáanin=tree + -tha=suffix for possession by reason of birth]     {orig}
to caress with the tongue [odith=tangue + lámála=caress]     {new}
love for that which is holy     {orig}
prayer [oham=love for that which is holy + di=to say, speak]     {orig}
respect despite negative circumstances [ohena, ohina, ohona, ohuna=respect]     {orig}
respect for good reasons [ohehena, ohina, ohona, ohuna=respect]     {orig}
respect for foolish reasons [ohehena, ohena, ohina, ohuna=respect]     {orig}
respect for bad reasons [ohehena, ohena, ohina, ohona=respect]     {orig}
depression as result of major trauma [olob=trauma + (e)shara=grief]     {DK}
family-clean, the usual state of affairs [onida=family + (h)éthe=clean] (See also: éthe, háawithéthe, huhéthe, mudahéthe, thóohéthe)     {CH}
spiritual orphanhood, being utterly bereft of a spiritual community [óotha=soul + nuthul=orphan]     {orig}
mind [óoya=heart + on=head + -tha=suffix for possession by reason of birth]     {orig}
time of greatest energy each day [óoya=heart + sháal=day]     {SH}
Amen, Selah, end of prayer phrase     {orig}
men’s garment, men’s clothing [owe=dress + -id=suffix for male]     {orig}
no, not (interjection); To make a sentence negative, put “ra” right after the verb.     {orig}
to be unable to feel lowitheláad, to be empathically impaired [ra=non- + edethi=to share]     {orig}
to be unwilling to feel lowitheláad; to be deliberately empathically impaired [ráahedethi=to be unable to feel lowitheláad + lh=negative connotation]     {orig}
to be musically or euphonically deprived     {orig}
to stink, reek [ra=non- + aba=to be fragrant + lh=negative connotation]     {orig}
to be young [ra=non- + balin=to be old]     {orig}
to take away from [ra=non- + ban=to give]     {orig}
gift with strings attached [ra=non- + bini=gift + lh=negative connotation]     {orig}
to non-touch, avoiding touch, to actively refrain from touching [ra=non- + dama=to touch]     {orig}
to non-touch with evil intent [radama=to non-touch + lh=negative connotation]     {orig}
non-garden, glitz without beauty, a place that has much flash and glitter and ornament, but no beauty [ra=non- + déela=garden]     {orig}
unfriendliness for good reasons [ra=non- + dena=friendliness for good reasons]     {orig}

non-holiday, holiday more work that it’s worth, a time allegedly a holiday but actually so much a burden because of work and preparations that it is a dreaded occasion; especially when there are too many guests and none of them help     {orig}
unfriendliness for no reason [ra=non- + dina= friendliness for no reason]     {orig}
to be weak [ra=non- + do=to be strong]     {orig}

non-interface, a situation which has not one single point in common on which to base interaction, often used of personal relationships [ra=non- + dodel=interface + lh= negative connotation]     {orig}
unfriendliness for foolish reasons [ra=non- + dona=friendliness for foolish reasons]     {orig}
unfriendliness for bad reasons [ra=non- + duna=friendliness for bad reasons]     {orig}
to non-use, to deliberately deprive someone of any useful function in the world, as in enforced retirement or when a human being is kept as a plaything or a pet [ra=non- + duth=to use]     {orig}
to not-heal, medicine or treatment which does not heal [ra=not + dutha=heal]     {SH}
to exile [ra=non- + habelid=to live, inhabit + lh=negative connotation]     {orig}
an exile, outcast [rahabelhid=to exile + -á=suffix for doer]     {orig}
to be temporally extensive; to be long-lived (time)     {AB}
to hoard, a hoard [ra=non- + eb=to buy, sell]     {orig}
accursed, unholy, to be accursed, to be unholy [ra=non- + héeda=to be sacred]     {orig}
to deliberately mistranslate with evil intent [rahéedan=to mistranslate + lh=give negative connotation]     {orig}

non-heart-sibling, one so entirely incompatible with another that there is no hope of ever achieving any kind of understanding or anything more than a truce, and no hope of ever making such a one understand why; (does not mean “enemy”) [ra=non- + héena =sibling of the heart]     {orig}
to be irresponsible [ra=non- + ahesh=to be responsible]     {orig}
to be dirty [ra=non- + éthe=to be clean]     {orig}
non-crime, a terrible thing done because it’s necessary but for which there is no blame because there is no choice (never an accident); [ra=non- + ib=crime]     {orig}
to non-attend, ignore, withhold attention [ra=non- + il=pay attention to]     {orig}
to non-attend, ignore, withhold attention with evil intent [rahil=to withhold attention + lh= gives negative connotation]     {orig}
to be big, large [ra=non- + híya=to be small]     {orig}
non-neighbor, one who lives nearby but does not fulfill a neighbor’s role (not necessarily pejorative) [obeth=neighbor]     {orig}
to non-teach, to deliberately fill students’ minds with empty data or false information; (can be used only of persons in a teacher/student relationship); [ra=non- + om=to teach]     {orig}
to be cold [ra=non- + owa=to be warm]     {orig}
to be closed [ra=non- + u=to be open]     {orig}
non-perceiver; one who fails to perceive [raláad=to non-perceive + -á=suffix for doer]     {orig}
non-perceiver, one who fails to perceive deliberately and with evil intent [raláadá=non-perceiver + lh=negative connotation]     {orig}
something utterly spiceless, bland, “like warm spit”, repulsively bland and blah [ra=non- + laheb=spice]     {orig}
tactile deprivation [ra=non- + lámála=to caress + lh=negative connotation]     {orig}
to be celibate not by choice     {orig}
to obfuscate [ra=non- + wedeth=to be clear + lh=negative connotation]     {orig}
love for evil [ra=non- + oham=love for that which is holy]     {orig}
to deliberately refrain from thinking about something, to wall it off in one’s mind by deliberate act [ra=non- + lith=to think]     {orig}
to be fast [ra=non- + lóolo=to be slow ]     {orig}
non-thunder, much talk and commotion from one (or more) with no real knowledge of what they’re talking about or trying to do, something like “hot air” but more so [ra=non+ lorolo=thunder]     {orig}
callousness for good reasons, disregard, to be callous [ra= non- + ména=compassion for good reasons]     {orig}
to refrain from asking, out of courtesy or kindness [ra=non- + mime=to ask]     {orig}
to refrain from asking, with evil intent; especially when it is clear that someone badly wants the other to ask [ramime=to refrain from asking + lh=give negative connotation]     {orig}
callousness for no reason, disregard, to be callous [ra-non- + mína=compassion for no reason]     {orig}
callousness for foolish reasons, disregard, to be callous [ra=non- + móna=compassion for foolish reasons]     {orig}
callousness for bad reasons, disregard, to be callous [ra=non- + múna=compassion for bad reasons]     {orig}
no how, in no way [ra=non- + -nal=suffix for manner]     {orig}

non-pearl, an ugly resentment or situation which worsens & festers, an ugly thing one builds layer by layer as an oyster does a pearl, such as a festering hatred to which one pays attention [ra=non+ nem=pearl]     {orig}
non-cup, a hollow accomplishment, something one acquires or receives or accomplishes but is empty of all satisfaction [ra=non- + ni=cup]     {orig}
to deliberately refrain from recording; for example, the failure throughout history to record the accomplishments of women [ra=non- + ri=to record, keep records + lh=negative connotation]     {orig}
non-synergy, that which when combined only makes things worse, less efficient, etc. [ra=non- + ru=synergy + lh=negative connotation]     {orig}
discord (not discord in the home) [ra=non- + sha=harmony]     {orig}
non-game, a cruel “playing” that is a game only for the dominant “player” with the power to force others to participate [ra=non- + shida=game]     {orig}
argument, quarrel, to argue, to quarrel, not used of an ‘argument’ in a theory or an equation or a proposition [ra-non- + shon=peace]     {orig}
to be bad [ra=non- + thal=to be good]     {orig}
despair for good reasons [ra=non- + thena=joy for good reasons]     {orig}
despair for no reason [ra=non- + thina=joy for no reason]     {orig}
non-pillow, one who lures another to trust and rely on them but has no intention of following through, a “lean on me so I can step aside and let you fall” person [ra=non- + thom=pillow]     {orig}
despair for foolish reasons [ra=non- + thona=joy for foolish reasons]     {orig}
non-guest, someone who comes to visit knowing perfectly well that they are intruding and causing difficulty [ra=non- + thóo=guest]     {orig}
despair for bad reasons [ra=non- + thuna=joy for bad reasons]     {orig}
to be murky, obscure [ra=non- + wedeth=to be clear]     {orig}

non-gestalt, a collection of parts with no relationship other than coincidence, a perverse choice of items to call a set; especially when used as “evidence” [ra=non- + wesha=gestalt + lh=negative connotation]     {orig}
to be dead [ra=non- + wíi=to be alive]     {orig}
barren one, to be barren [ra-non- + wóobaná=birth giver]     {orig}

silence that is comfortable and natural [rile=silence + ana=food]     {Grammar Updates: TB}
silence that is a purposeful refusal to communicate, with a denial that it’s even happening (see rilhehum) [rile=silence + hum=knife]     {Grammar Updates: TB}
silence acutely painful to you, but the other person seems totally unaware [rile=silence + plus “absence”]     {Grammar Updates: TB}

malicious silence acutely painful to you     {Grammar Updates: TB}
hypothetical, would, might, let’s suppose (Time Auxiliary)     {orig}

to come, to go (differentiated by the ‘source’ or ‘goal’ marker on the following noun)     {orig}
growth through transcendence, either of a person, a non-human, or thing (for example, an organization, or a city, or a sect) [sháad=to come, go + -hul=suffix denoting to an extreme degree]     {orig}

grief with reason, but with no blame and not futile (see: shala, shama, shara, shina)     {orig}
grief with reason, with blame, and futile (see: shala, shama, shana, shina)     {orig}
mother (formal term, honored mother) [sha=harmony + thul=parent] (see: mathul, ethul)     {orig}
retired career, elder career, the work you do after you’ve officially retired [shawith=elder + (e)hal=work] (see didehal, ruhobehal)     {new}

to “sexual act”, engage in sex, copulation (abstract and completely neutral term)     {orig}

grief without reason or blame, not futile (see: shala, shama, shana, shara)     {orig}

to come to pass, to happen     {orig}

happiness, joy: despite negative circumstances: to be joyful, to be happy (thena, thina, thona, thuma= joy]     {orig}

gate [u=to be open + rahu=to be not open]     {orig}
known to X because perceived by X (externally or internally) (evidence morpheme): “The reason I claim that what I’m saying is true is that I have perceived it myself”     {orig}
assumed false by X because X distrusts source (evidence morpheme)     {orig}
assumed true by X because X trusts source (evidence morpheme)     {orig}

assumed false by speaker because source is not trusted and evil intent by source is assumed, assumed false by X because X distrusts source and X suspects source of acting with evil intent (evidence morpheme)     {orig}
to be placid, still, calm (as of water, wind)     {orig}
perceived by speaker in a dream, perceived by X in a dream (evidence morpheme)     {orig}
mall, a gathering of stores [wehe=store + buth=gather]     {new}
gratitude despite negative circumstances, to be grateful (see: wéná, wíná, wóná, wúná)     {orig}

an evidential meaning “The reason I claim that what I’m saying is true is because it’s self-evident; everybody can see that it’s true, or everybody is in agreement that it’s true.”; known to X because self-evident (evidence morpheme)     {orig}
phone guest, a guest who calls before they come [widadith=telephone + (e)thóo=guest] (See also: thóo, áathethóo, nithedimethóo, shineshidethóo)     {CH}
when [wida=carry + hath=time] 1) Bíi lalom le widahath hal le wa. “I sing when I work.” 2) Bíi widahath hal le, lalom le wa. “When I work, I sing.”
why [wida=carry + huth=reason] Bíi widahuth eril náhal with, lothel ra le wa. “Why the woman kept working, I don’t know.”
how [wida=carry + weth=path] : Bíi widaweth aril mebedi háawith, lothel ra le wa. “How the children will learn, I don’t know.”
to be pregnant late in term and eager for the end [wida=to carry + lawida=to be pregnant]     {orig}
optative mode, indicating an option or wish (Time Auxiliary)
let there be…, would that…, may, let it be     {orig}
greeting, (hello) “Let there be harmony” [wil=let there be + sha=harmony]     {orig}
gratitude for no reason, to be grateful (see: wéhená, wéná, wóná, wúná)     {orig}
abortion, to abort, have an abortion [wí+raban+ena+th]     {CF}
person, woman, adult ; to specify a male person, add the masculine suffix ‘-id’     {orig}

birth (time) ‘at birth’ (at the time she was born) [woban=birth + -(e)ya=suffix for case marker time]

all, every (don’t change form or add case marker)     {orig}

genitalia (female, all) all female genitalia & reproductive oragans [wo+óol]     {SH}
a word meaning the opposite of alienation; to feel joined to, part of someone or something without reservations or barriers [woho=all; sheni=intersection]     {orig}
gratitude for foolish reasons, to be grateful (see: wéhená, wéná, wíná, wúná)     {orig}

speaker has total lack of knowledge as to the validity, indicates that X states a total lack of know ledge as to the validity of the matter (evidence morpheme)     {orig}
gratitude for bad reasons, to be grateful (see: wúná, wéhená, wéná, wíná, wóná)     {orig}

solid (as opposed to gas or liquid)     {CH}
hurricane [yul=wind + -hul=suffix denoting to an extreme degree]     {orig}
regret with reason, with blame, and not futile (see: zhala, zhama, zhana, zhara, zhina)     {orig}
the act of relinquishing a cherished/ comforting/familiar illusion or frame of perception [zha=name + láad=to perceive]     {orig}
regret with reason, but with no blame, and futile (see: zhala, zhana, zhara, zhina)
regret with reason, but with no blame and not futile (see: zhala, zhama, zhara, zhina)
regret with reason, with blame, and futile (see: zhala, zhama, zhana, zhina)
resemble; be reminiscent of [zhe=similar + dam=show signs of state or emotion]     {AB}

to menstruate in sync with another woman, menstruation [zhe=like +sháana]
cooperation, to cooperate [zhe=alike + shub=do] (see also:zhelith, zhedi, zheláad, zhethob)     {AB}

agreement, written agreement [zhe=alike + thob=write] (see also:zhelith, zhedi, zheshub, zheláad)     {AB}
